description:
Use this resource to generate an OpenStack Object Storage temporary URL.

The temporary URL will be valid for as long as TTL is set to (in seconds).
Once the URL has expired, it will no longer be valid, but the resource
will remain in place. If you wish to automatically regenerate a URL, set
the `regenerate` argument to `true`. This will create a new resource with
a new ID and URL.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

Container.description: The container name the object belongs to.

Method.description:
The method allowed when accessing this URL.
Valid values are `GET`, and `POST`. Default is `GET`.

Object.description: The object name the tempurl is for.

Regenerate.description:
Whether to automatically regenerate the URL when
it has expired. If set to true, this will create a new resource with a new
ID and new URL. Defaults to false.

Region.description: The region the tempurl is located in.

Ttl.description:
The TTL, in seconds, for the URL. For how long it should
be valid.
